intro: Nasturtium spathulatum, commonly known as the broadleaf nasturtium, is a flowering plant belonging to the Tropaeolaceae family. It is characterized by its heart-shaped, broad leaves and vibrant, showy flowers that come in shades of orange and red. The plant is native to South America and thrives in warm, sunny climates. Its flowers are edible and often used in salads or as a garnish, while the leaves can be consumed as well. Nasturtium spathulatum is also known for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
